info.description: Connective eSignatures is a renowned digital signature solution offering a vast amount of signature methods & compliance to the most stringent (inter)national regulations. eSignatures allows you to transform any paper-based process into an end-to-end digital flow with an unparalleled user experience. Streamline the signing process exactly how you want it to and send, sign & track all types of documents directly from your favorite business applications. Join more than 500 satisfied customers.
info.title: Connective eSignatures

SigningType.description: The signing type used in this actor's session.

CommitmentTypes.description: One or more OIDs of commitment types. Can only be passed when signature policy is used.

MandatedSignerValidation.description: Type of validation to execute during eID other smart card, or itsme signing session.

MandatedSignerIds.description: Defines which eID or other smart cards are allowed to sign during this session.

SignaturePolicyId.description: Signing policy details for the signature.

PageNumber.description: Number of the page on which to add a signing location

Left.description: Position from the left of the page

Top.description: Position from top of the page

MarkerOrFieldId.description: Unique reference to a signing field, text marker or textfield.

Request.Actor.description: This object gives information about what the stakeholder must do.

OrderIndex.description: This number specifies in which order actors need to execute their action.

SigningFields.description: Define the locations where this actor should sign

SigningTypes.description: One or more signing type info objects.

Phonenumber.description: Phone number to receive an SMS OTP.

RedirectUrl.description: Url to which the end user is redirected after signing.

SendNotifications.description: eSignatures can send e-mails to all the people who are allowed to sign.

UserRoles.description: Role or function of the signer.

LegalNoticeText.description: Custom legal notice text in case none of the three predefined legal notices apply.

Stakeholder.description: Information about the people who are involved in the process.

ErrorHandlingResponse.description: The eSignatures API v3 uses HTTP error codes to give a rough idea of whether a call succeeded or failed, and a system of error codes in the response body to give more information incase things went wrong.

Message.description: Error message detail text, not localized

PackageDocument.description: Details for each of the documents in the package

ExternalDocumentReference.description: Returns the external reference of this document as it was passed in through the Add document to package call.

DocumentType.description: Type of document within the package.

PackageStatus.description: Description for the Package shown to the eSignatures Portal user as file name.

PackageName.description: Description for the Package shown to the eSignatures Portal user as file name.

CreationTimestamp.description: Date and time when the package was created according to the server.

Initiator.description: Initiator field of the package as it was passed in at creation time.

ExpiryTimestamp.description: UTC formatted time at which the document expires. Can be null.

ExternalPackageReference.description: Returns the external reference id of the package as it was passed in at creation time.

F2FSigningUrl.description: Link to the package which allows to pick from all the signing session at once.

PackageStatus.description: Status of the package as a whole:

PackageDocuments.description: Details for each of the documents in the package.

Stakeholders.description: Details for each of the persons which will interact with the package.

Type.description: Type of stakeholder: Person, PersonGroup, or ContactGroup.

PersonGroupName.description: Name of the person group. Only returned if Type was set to PersonGroup in the request.

ContactGroupCode.description: Code of the contact group. Only returned if Type was set to ContactGroup in the request.

ExternalStakeholderReference.description: External reference identifying this person in the external system.

Actors.description: Details of all steps to take.

ActorId.description: Unique id for this combination of action, stakeholder and document.

ActionUrl.description: URL that this person can open to interact with the package.

ActionUrls.description: Array of URLs that the different persons of the PersonGroup or ContactGroup can open to interact with the package.

items.description: Array of URLs that the different persons can open to interact with the package.

Url.description: URL that this person can open to interact with the package.

CompletedBy.description: The name of the end user who completed the action.

CompletedTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the moment on which this action was completed.

Reason.description: Returns the text entered by the person who changed the status of a package to a final state (e.g. a reject).

Locations.description: Represents a possible location for a signature.

UsedSigningType.description: Returns the signing type that was used to sign the document.

post.description: This call creates a package with a single document in it and instantly prepares it for signing

Document.description: Attached document in base64 encoded format. Required unless Multipart format is used.

DocumentLanguage.description: Language to use in signature texts. Currently supported: en, nl, de, fr, es.

DocumentName.description: Name of the document and package to be shown in the eSignatures Portal.

Initiator.description: Email address of a registered user

Stakeholders.description: Information about the people who are involved in the process.

CallBackUrl.description: REST API URL that will be called each time an action has been completed for this package

CorrelationId.description: Id that indicates which packages or documents are correlated

DocumentGroupCode.description: The ‘Code’ which identifies a document group in which the document should be shown

ThemeCode.description: Theme that must be applied to the package

DownloadUnsignedFiles.description: This parameter determines whether packages can be downloaded from the WYSIWYS before signing

ReassignEnabled.description: This parameter determines whether packages can be reassigned from the WYSIWYS to another approver/signer.

ActionUrlExpirationPeriodInDays.description: This parameter determines after how many days the action URLs must expire when they are not used.

ExpiryTimestamp.description: Reference given by the calling application. This parameter will not be used by the eSignatures Portal

ExternalDocumentReference.description: Reference given by the calling application, this parameter will not be used by the eSignatures Portal

ExternalPackageReference.description: Reference given by the calling application, this parameter will not be used by the eSignatures Portal

F2FRedirectUrl.description: Url to which the end user is redirected after all fields have been signed with ‘face to face’ signing, or when all fields have been rejected.

NotificationCallBackUrl.description: REST API URL that will be called when an end user requests to be notified. If no URL is supplied no call back is performed

PdfErrorHandling.description: How to deal with PDFs containing minor flaws

Representation.description: Attached representation document in base64 format

RepresentationType.description: Type of the representation document, must be present when Representation is filled. Only “application/pdf” is supported.

SigningTemplateCode.description: The template configured in the portal will provide all necessary information

TargetType.description: The TargetType defines if an extra conversion to PDF/A needs to be done before signing

CreationTimestamp.description: Date and time when the package was created according to the server.

get.description: Get a list of packages with their current status

parameters.name: ContinuationToken
parameters.description: The continuation token / guid to know what page to return. MUST BE EMPTY or the token returned from a PREVIOUS call.
parameters.x-ms-summary: The continuation token / guid to know what page to return.

parameters.name: MaxQuantity
parameters.description: Gets or sets the maximum quantity.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Gets or sets the maximum quantity.

parameters.name: SortField
parameters.description: Gets or sets the sort field.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Gets or sets the sort field.

parameters.name: SortOrder
parameters.description: Gets or sets the sort field.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Gets or sets the sort field.

parameters.name: CreatedBeforeDate
parameters.description: Gets or sets the created before date.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Gets or sets the created before date.

parameters.name: createdAfterDate
parameters.description: Gets or sets the created after date.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Gets or sets the created after date.

post.description: This call creates an empty package, allowing documents to be added to it

Initiator.description: Email address of a registered user.

PackageName.description: Package name, seen in the eSignatures Portal and when downloading as zip file.

CallBackUrl.description: REST API URL that will be called each time an action has been completed for this package.

CorrelationId.description: Id that indicates which packages are correlated.

DocumentGroupCode.description: The ‘Code’ which identifies a document group in which the package should be shown.

ThemeCode.description: Theme that must be applied to the package

DownloadUnsignedFiles.description: This parameter determines whether packages can be downloaded from the WYSIWYS before signing.

ReassignEnabled.description: This parameter determines whether packages can be reassigned from the WYSIWYS to another approver/signer.

ActionUrlExpirationPeriodInDays.description: This parameter determines after how many days the action URLs must expire when they are not used.

ExpiryTimestamp.description: The date and time when this package expires and can no longer be signed.

ExternalPackageReference.description: Reference given by the calling application. This parameter will not be used by the eSignatures Portal.

ExternalPackageData.description: This field is reserved for future use. It can be used for customer-specific extensions to integrate with third-party services, such as Debit Card signing.

F2FRedirectUrl.description: URL to which the end user is redirected after all fields have been signed with 'face to face' signing, or when all fields have been rejected.

NotificationCallBackUrl.description: REST API URL that will be called when an end user requests to be notified.

CreationTimestamp.description: Date and time when the package was created according to the server.

post.description: This call will add a document to an existing package.

Document.description: Attached document in base64 encoded format.

DocumentLanguage.description: Language to use in signature texts.

DocumentName.description: Name of the document to be shown in the eSignatures Portal.

SigningFields.description: One or more signing locations in the document.

CorrelationId.description: Id that indicates which documents within this package are correlated with documents that have been signed in the past in other packages.

DocumentType.description: Type of document that will be signed.

ExternalDocumentReference.description: Reference given by the calling application.

Representation.description: Attached representation document in base64 format. This must be PDF data.

TargetType.description: The TargetType defines if an extra conversion to PDF/A needs to be done before signing.

200.description: The document was correctly added to the package. The response contains more information about the locations where a signer can place a signature.

CreationTimestamp.description: Date and time the flow was created. Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+zz:zz

Locations.description: Represents a possible location for a signature

PageNumber.description: The page on which the location was found.

400.description: The request contained parameters which could not be accepted.

404.description: The package id could not be found in the database.

409.description: When certain document conversions are forbidden, when the input document has issues, or when marker ids are not matched.

get.description: This call provides an overview of all signing locations inside the documents within a package.

200.description: The signing locations from the package are returned successfully.

ExternalDocumentReference.description: External reference for identification. Make sure to use a unique value.

Locations.description: Represents a possible location for a signature

Label.description: Value you entered as Request parameter.

PageNumber.description: Number of the page on which the signature can be found.

404.description: The package Id given does not exist.

409.description: The package with the specified id was made with an old version of the api.

get.description: Retrieves the current state of the package and its documents.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Unique id for the signing package
parameters.x-ms-summary: Unique id for the signing package

404.description: The package with the specified id could not be found.

409.description: The package with the specified id was made with an old version of the api.

put.description: By means of the Set Package Status call, you can change the status of a package.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Unique id for the signing package
parameters.x-ms-summary: Unique id for the signing package

200.description: The package was successfully changed to the new status.

404.description: When an unknown package id is passed.

409.description: When the package doesn't contain any documents or the status doesn't allow revocation.

post.description: This call skips all signers that haven’t signed yet and sets their status to “Skipped”, which results in the complete package being marked as “Finished”.

200.description: All signers that hadn’t signed yet were successfully skipped.

get.description: The package containing the signed documents can be downloaded by an external system using this call.

409.description: The package hasn't been fully signed.

get.description: The signed documents in a package can be downloaded one by one by an external system using this call. Each document will be downloaded as a PDF, or as an XML file stream, depending on the value of the DocumentType parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for the signing package
parameters.x-ms-summary: Unique id for the signing package

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: Unique id of the document contained in the package
parameters.x-ms-summary: Unique id of the document contained in the package

404.description: The document cannot be found or is not part of the specified package.

409.description: The package hasn't been fully signed.

put.description: A package may have the status Expired when a package passed a value for the ExpiryTimestamp parameter in the Create Package call. Such a package can no longer be signed.

200.description: The update package expiry timestamp was set.

400.description: The request contained parameters which could not be accepted.

409.description: When the status of the document does not allow to extend the expiration period.

post.description: Company policy might require that a document is handled within a given timespan. Triggering the “send reminders” call will look up everybody who hasn’t signed and send them an extra notification as a reminder.

400.description: The package with the given id could not be found.

409.description: The package did not have status Pending.

delete.description: eSignatures does not automatically delete packages from the database once they have reached a final state. They are stored indefinitely. To delete packages from the database, users can use the Delete Package call.

404.description: The package with the given id could not be found.

409.description: The package’s status is still in a non-final state (e.g. Pending, Expired) so it can’t be deleted yet.

put.description: This webservice method updates the people involved in the process (stakeholders) and assigns them steps which need to be taken.

Actors.description: Array with more information about what the stakeholder must do.

OrderIndex.description: This number specifies in which order actors need to execute their action.

LocationIds.description: The location ids where a signature must be placed by this person.

SigningTypes.description: One or more signing type info objects.

Phonenumber.description: Phone number to receive an SMS OTP.

RedirectURL.description: Url to which the end user is redirected after signing, or rejecting. The redirect occurs immediately after signing or rejecting.

SendNotifications.description: eSignatures can send e-mails to the actors whose action is required, such as signing

UserRoles.description: The location ids where a signature must be placed by this person.

LegalNoticeCode.description: The 3 values will point to the 3 legal notices built into the application. These can be altered in the Configuration Index.

LegalNoticetext.description: Custom legal notice text in case none of the three predefined legal notices apply

Language.description: UI language of this stakeholder. Currently supported: en, nl, de, fr, es.

BirthDate.description: Date of birth in format: YYYY-MM-DD

ExternalStakeholderReference.description: Reference given by the calling application. This parameter will not be used by the eSignatures Portal.

200.description: The process information has successfully been added to the package.

400.description: There are invalid parameters in the request.

404.description: When an unknown package id is passed.

409.description: Some parameters conflict with the data found in the database or configuration.

get.description: A package’s audit proofs xml can be retrieved when the package is fully signed. The same applies for a document: it only works when the containing package is fully signed.

200.description: The Audit proofs xml is returned.

404.description: Not Found  The documentation/package id could not be found.

409.description: Conflict  The package is not fully signed.

get.description: A package’s audit proofs xml can be retrieved when the package is fully signed. The same applies for a document: it only works when the containing package is fully signed.
get.summary: Package Audit Proof with document ID

200.description: The Audit proofs xml is returned.

404.description: Not Found  The documentation/package id could not be found.

409.description: Conflict  The package is not fully signed.

get.description: Correlation ids are used to track packages or documents across several passes through the eSignatures application.

200.description: The Audit proofs xml is returned.

404.description: Not Found  The documentation/package id could not be found.

409.description: Conflict  The package is not fully signed.

get.description: Correlation ids are used to track packages or documents across several passes through the eSignatures application.

200.description: The Audit proofs xml is returned.

404.description: Not Found  The documentation/package id could not be found.

409.description: Conflict  The package is not fully signed.

post.description: This call allows API users to add extra proofs from an external source to a location on a document.

parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Package
parameters.x-ms-summary: The unique ID of the Package

Content.description: The actual content of the proof.

LocationId.description: Location of the signature for which the proof content was generated.

Type.description: A machine-readable “type” key. Can be freely chosen.

Description.description: Brief human-readable description of the proof.

IpAddress.description: IP address of the end user of the external source for which the proof was added.

204.description: The proof was created for the requested location.

400.description: The request contained parameters which could not be accepted.

404.description: The documentId or the LocationId could not be found.

409.description: The proof could not be added due to some other reason.
